_comment: Example LLVM Obfuscation Report - Failed Baseline Scenario
_example_type: Failed Baseline - Shows baseline_status and comparison_valid Fixes
_note: When baseline compilation fails, the report now properly indicates failure instead of returning fake zero metrics
warnings: Baseline compilation failed with error: undefined reference to 'std::exception'
Comparison metrics are unreliable - use obfuscated binary metrics only

baseline_metrics._note: All metrics are zero/error because baseline compilation failed

comparison._note: All comparison metrics are invalid when baseline_status is failed

bogus_code_info._note: Using safe defaults because baseline metrics unavailable

string_obfuscation._note: Obfuscated metrics available, but no baseline comparison

_critical_fix_explanation.before_fix: Old behavior would return all zeros: file_size=0, symbols_count=0, entropy=0.0, making it appear the obfuscation completely stripped everything (100% reduction)
_critical_fix_explanation.after_fix: New behavior returns baseline_status='failed' and comparison_valid=false, plus warnings explaining why metrics are unreliable. Frontend can detect this and show appropriate message.
_critical_fix_explanation.reason: Different compilation toolchains or missing dependencies cause baseline to fail. Returning fake zeros misleads users about obfuscation effectiveness. Now the failure is explicit and frontend can handle it appropriately.
